metadata.dc:author: Barbón García, J J
Alvarez Suárez, M L
Pastor Hernández, L
Alvarez-Buylla Camino, M
Morís De La Tassa, G
metadata.dc:description: CASE REPORT We present a case of metastatic larynx cancer in the cavernous sinus. It presented itself as a right sixth cranial nerve palsy which progressed into a painful ophthalmoplegia with normal CT and RNM in its early stages. DISCUSSION We must suspect a cavernous sinus invasion in patients with cranial nerve palsies and with a history of malignancy, despite negative radiologic findings. Tumoral invasion of the skull base has been described in pharyngeal neoplasms but it is exceptional in larynx carcinomas.
metadata.dc:title: Oftalmoplejía dolorosa secundaria a carcinoma de laringe.
[Painful ophthalmoplegia secondary to larynx carcinoma].
metadata.dc:publisher: Archivos de la Sociedad Espanola de Oftalmologia
